colorize <- function(x, color) {
  if (knitr::is_latex_output()) {
    sprintf("\\textcolor{%s}{%s}", color, x)
  } else if (knitr::is_html_output()) {
    sprintf(
      "<span style='color: %s;'>%s</span>", color,
      x
    )
  } else {
    x
  }
}

```{r, include = F}
n <- c(seq(20, 100, 5), 125, 150, 200, 300, 400, 500)
k <- 0:10

tab <- matrix(NA, nrow = length(n), ncol = length(k))
for (rows in 1:length(n)) {
  for (columns in 1:length(k)) {
    tab[rows, columns] <- evaluation(materiality = 0.10, n = n[rows], x = k[columns], method = "binomial")$p.value
  }
}

table <- as.data.frame(tab)
table <- cbind(n = n, table)
colnames(table) <- c("Sample Size", k)

table[, 2:12] <- format.pval(table[, 2:12], digits = 2, eps = 0.01)
```

```{r, echo = FALSE}
ktable <- knitr::kable(table,
  digits = 2,
  caption = "<center>Table 1: Statistical Sampling Results based on the Binomial Distribution — <br>One-sided <i>p</i> Values against a Performance Materiality of 10 Percent</center>",
  align = "l",
  format = "html",
  row.names = FALSE,
  format.args = list(big.mark = ",", scientific = FALSE),
  table.attr = "style='width:150%;'"
)
ktable <- kableExtra::kable_classic(ktable, position = "center", html_font = "Cambria")
ktable <- kableExtra::add_header_above(ktable, header = c(" " = 1, "Actual Number of Misstatements Found" = 11))
ktable <- kableExtra::footnote(ktable, general = "This table presents one-sided p values against the null hypothesis \u03B8 = 0.1")
ktable <- kableExtra::row_spec(ktable, seq(2, nrow(table) - 1, 2), background = "#F0F8FF")
ktable <- kableExtra::kable_styling(ktable, font_size = 11)
kableExtra::kable_paper(ktable, "striped")
```
